meaning_mnemonic: At first this looks like a cross in the ground, but it's actually something growing in the <radical>dirt</radical>. It's a little sprout, already rocking three leaves. And it's all thanks to that dirt! When you see this radical, think about how amazing it is that things just, like, grow in the dirt.

This is the <radical>sword</radical> radical. The ノ part is the curvy sword, while the rest is a samurai bowing deeply, like 90 degrees, as he holds that sword — probably before a sword fight. By the way, don't confuse this with the power radical (力). See the difference? In the sword radical (刀), the ノ doesn't pierce through the bowing samurai. (Lucky for him.)

This radical looks like a <radical>narwhal</radical>. See the tail at the bottom, and the majestic narwhal horn poking out at the top? It also looks like the katakana character ナ (na), so you can remember it that way too. Na-na-na-narwhal! Just be careful not to confuse this with the treasure radical (メ). The sideways line for that one is at more of a downward angle, like an "X." But the sideways line for narwhal is horizontal (ナ).
Imagine viewing this one from above — looks like a couple of streets, right? Maybe a three-way intersection at the top there? Well, that's why this is the radical for <radical>street</radical>.
This radical already looks like a pair of <radical>legs</radical>. There's even feet on these legs. That's how you know these are legs and not fins (or something else).

This is the outline of a <radical>head</radical>. A really square head, admittedly, but try to imagine it facing to the right. The left side is the back of the head, and the barb-like part on the right shows the curve of the chin. See the head?
This radical is <radical>treasure</radical> because "X marks the spot," as they say. Doesn't it look like the X on a pirate treasure map? You want to go find that treasure now, right?!

You have a slide supported by a big cross, which makes it so strong it can hold a lot of people at once. How many? A <radical>THOUSAND</radical>! Imagine a thousand people going down this slide. You can hear a voice trying to count them as they go: "ONE! TWO! THREE HUNDRED! FIVE HUNDRED!" and so on. Finally the last person slides down and the voice calls out: "A THOUSAND!" You think it's over, but just as that group finishes, in come another thousand…

This is the top half of a moon peeking out as it begins to rise. When does that happen? In the <radical>evening</radical>! Don't confuse this with the moon radical 月. 夕 is for the evening, when the moon's still low enough to be partly covered (by a mountain, for example).
This is the radical for <radical>child</radical>. Aww, see how they're wearing a cap and have their little arms stretched out? You can almost hear them saying "pick me up!" A very child-like child.

You see two fins around a barb, but when you look closer, you realize those fins are actually two tiny fish. Think how small these fins (and fish) would have to be to look so much smaller than an already small barb. Talk about small fry… Yeah, that's why this is the radical for <radical>small</radical>.

This radical looks like a fancy composite <radical>bow</radical> people would use to shoot at targets and definitely not any normal living animals. See how the middle part is being pulled back? Imagine holding this bow and firing it at a target shaped like a giant alligator-crab monster.
See the <radical>flag</radical> in this radical? There's a pole with a flag on the end of it, blowing in the wind. Basically, this radical looks just like a flag.
These three streaks look like the flowing locks of someone's <radical>hair</radical>. Pretty easy to see and remember that this is the hair radical, right?

If you use your imagination, this radical actually looks like the number "5." You just have to remove the vertical line in the bottom left, plus a few extra ends that stick out here and there. Once you do that, you have an easy way to remember that this radical means <radical>five</radical>.

Remember the guy from the big radical? This is him again, but this time he's so big his head is touching <radical>heaven</radical>. He's looking up and has his arms stretched open toward heaven, and his big hair is poking into those heavenly clouds.

This is the <radical>hand</radical> radical. If you look at the palm of your right hand, the lines in it probably kinda look like the lines in 手. Sure it's not a perfect match, and everyone's got different hands, but basically this radical looks like the lines in your hand. 

You could also think of the horizontal lines in 手 as fingers. That would make for a pretty alien-looking hand, but still a hand… of sorts…

This looks like a stool with a lid on it, but it's actually a desk for <radical>writing</radical>. Do you see it? You can even see the pen sticking up in the middle. Think of all the beautiful writing that's been produced here. Letters, novels, essays — any kind of writing you can think of.

This is the <radical>moon</radical> radical. See how it looks like a crescent moon with a couple of little clouds floating by? Try not to mix this up with the evening radical 夕 — you can see the whole crescent moon this time, so obviously this should be the radical for moon!

There's a stick and a giant toe stuck in the ground. Imagine walking along and seeing these things in your path. What would you do? Most likely come to a complete <radical>stop</radical>. You know, because of the toe. I guess a normal stop sign wasn't good enough, so they also put up this big toe to really get people to stop.

This is the radical for <radical>water</radical>. It's the water radical because it kind of looks like water coming out of a faucet and splashing everywhere. See how it flows off in different directions too? Very water-like! As water-like as a radical can be, anyway…

This is the radical for <radical>fire</radical>. It's got three little flames on top and even a couple logs underneath.

But if it helps you can also focus on the person radical here. See it? It's got things coming off of it... What are those thi— OH MY GOD IT'S FIRE!!! Help, help! Put the fire out! Wait, it's fine… It's just the fire radical.

Remember the big guy who helped you with that big radical? Now you've got his big <radical>DOG</radical>! You know it's a dog because he's lying down, legs all spread out, with his favorite bone right beside his head.

This is the <radical>king</radical> radical. Picture this king sitting on his solid, squarish throne. The top stroke is the high back of the throne. The cross in the middle is his body, with his arms spread out on the arm rests. The bottom stroke is the ground. See him sitting there now, looking all dignified. Talk about a kingly king.

This is a stick going through the <radical>middle</radical> of a mouth. What kind of mouth? Mouth of a cylinder, mouth of a box, a human mouth — whatever kind you want to imagine, as long as the stick is going through the middle of it, since this is the radical for "middle."

What's something useful you can get out of a tree? A <radical>book</radical>! Just cut that book right out of the tree trunk. If you think about it, every tree contains unlimited book potential. It's just a shame they have to be cut down to make the books…

In Japan rice paddies are made up of square fields with irrigation lines going between them. See the four rice paddies with water flowing between and around them? That's why this radical is <radical>rice paddy</radical>.

Add a drop of the sun to something and it will turn it <radical>white</radical>. The sun is really strong, so even a single drop will burn anything white. Why do you think so many beaches are white? Even the drops of sunblock you use to stop the sun's rays is white. So when you think of sun drops, think white.

See the iris in the middle of the eyeball? Remember that there are no round things in kanji, so square things take their place. That makes this a pretty realistic, square <radical>eye</radical>. You just have to squint with your real eyes a bit.

This looks like someone in a standing position with legs planted firmly on the ground, spreading their arms out in a T-pose to maintain balance. So that makes this the radical for <radical>stand</radical>.

This is the <radical>cow</radical> radical. It kind of looks like the long face of a cow, right? Specifically a boy cow, since you can think of that top horizontal line as its horns. Seeing it yet? It's got a little tuft of hair on its head, and some kind of accessory on the horn to your left, so this is a very stylish cow.

(And yes, you may say a "boy cow" isn't a "cow," but we're still calling this a cow. Please don't write in about it — we don't want any beef.)

This is a little triangle that's almost completely closed off. When you want to be alone, you hide in a place where you can be in <radical>private</radical>. That's why this is the private radical. You're closing yourself off to the rest of the world, with just a little peephole.
There's a leaf on top and a stem going down out of it, making this the <radical>leaf</radical> radical. It's a pretty wide and flat leaf, so if it helps you can imagine it as a lily pad leaf.
